hints.content:
Let's use a place value chart to compare the numbers.

Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
$0$ | $\purpleC3$ | $\purpleC3$ | $\purpleC0$
$0$ | $\blueD3$ | $\blueD1$ | $\blueD3$
$\greenD3$ | $\greenD0$ | $\greenD1$ | $\greenD3$

options.explanation:
We start by comparing the highest place value.

$\greenD{3{,}013}$ has the greatest thousands, so it is the greatest number.

$?, ?, \greenD{3{,}013}$

$\purpleC{330}$ and $\blueD{313}$ both have $0$ thousands and $3$ hundreds.  So, we let's compare their tens.  $\blueD{313}$ has fewer tens, so it is the smallest number.  

$\blueD{313}, ?,  \greenD{3013}$

This leaves $\purpleC{330}$ as the middle number.

hints.content:

$\blueD{313}, \purpleC{330}, \greenD{3{,}013}$
